job_description: Senior Manager, Pharmacometrician (PK Data Scientist) - job post Scipro global Redwood City, CA 94063 • Remote $80 - $85 an hour -  Contract Responded to 51-74% of applications in the past 30 days, typically within 7 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $80 - $85 an hour Job Type Contract Senior Manager, Pharmacometrician (PK Data Scientist) 6 month contract+extension/conversion (remote) We are partnering with a forefront clinical stage oncolytic biotech company aiming to target elusive frontiers and inhibit growth of cancerous bio-mechanic pathways. With multiple projects in various clinical stages, they are looking to expand their team and talent! We are looking for an experienced Senior Manager/Pharmacometrician to help the Non-Clinical Development and Clinical Pharmacology team (NDCP) and one who is passionate about creating an everlasting change within the oncology sector. Responsibilities: As a key PK data scientist to support the pharmacometrics functions in the department, you will; Build the internal infrastructure for PKPD data preprocessing and visualization. Develop and manage automatic workflows (i.e. data uptake, QC, data integration and reformatting) for clinical PKPD and endpoint data. Apply statistical and computational methods to analyze complex PKPD data Desired Qualifications A Ph.D. or M.S. with a quantitative science background (mathematics, statistics, engineering, pharmaceutical sciences, computational biology, etc.). Must be proficient in R programing and development of RStudio / Shiny apps. Must have working knowledge in time series analysis in the graduate coursework and/or postgraduate job functions. Must be familiar with the concepts of repeated measures and mixed models. Able to take dynamically assigned pharmacometrics tasks and deliver the results in a timely manner. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and ability to clearly convey complex concepts and findings to both non-specialist and specialist audiences. A critical thinker and passionate team player and quick learner with high energy who thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Demonstrated experience and track record in clinical-stage drug development is a big plus but not required. Hands-on experience of using commercial and/or open source ODE / PKPD modeling software is desired. superb communication skills orally and virtually Vaccinated against Covid-19 Job Type: Contract Pay: $80.00 - $85.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Day shift Monday to Friday Application Question(s): How many years of PK Modeling experience do you have? Education: Master's (Required) Experience: R studio (Required) Work Location: One location If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

AI Engineer - Multi-year CONTRACT ROLE (This position is not eligible for employment visa sponsorship) - job post Volkswagen Group of America - Chattanooga Operations Belmont, CA $118,000 - $175,000 a year -  Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $118,000 - $175,000 a year Job Type Contract AI Engineer - Multi-year CONTRACT ROLE (This position is not eligible for employment visa sponsorship) - ICC000172 - Hybrid Primary Location United States-California-Belmont VW. Two letters. Endless opportunities. A bright future. Innovation. Sophistication. Optimization. This is our Passion. Worldwide, the Volkswagen Group has a long tradition of dramatic innovations. The Volkswagen Group with its headquarters in Wolfsburg is one of the world’s leading automobile manufacturers and the largest carmaker in Europe. The Group comprises twelve brands from seven European countries: Volkswagen Passenger Cars, Audi, SEAT, ŠKODA, Bentley, Bugatti, Lamborghini, Porsche, Ducati, Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles, Scania and MAN. Here in the US, we are blending German engineering with American ingenuity. At the Innovation & Engineering Center California (IECC) , we represent the Volkswagen Group in applied research and development. Located in the heart of Silicon Valley, we create bold new ideas for the Volkswagen, Audi, Bentley, Lamborghini, Bugatti and Porsche brands. We’re a team of engineers, designers, scientists, and psychologists looking to develop innovations for future generations of cars, and to transfer technologies from many industries and research institutions into the automotive domain. Our mission is to drive change which means we are not only influencing one of the world’s largest carmakers, but also the lives of millions of people. Are you ready to join us? AI Engineer - This position is not eligible for employment visa sponsorship Role Summary This role will be tasked with applying machine learning/deep learning to the automotive industry. Applications could include autonomous driving, manufacturing, material design etc. Working in our facility requires a high level of independence and an ability to deal with lots of ambiguity. In addition to assigned projects, this individual and subsequent team will be responsible for coming up with the “next big thing” that nobody has thought of as yet, building it and selling it. This position should be held by a Computer Science Engineer, or equivalent, with experience in the development of Software and Software architectures. Role Responsibility Machine Learning Engineer - Multi-year CONTRACT ROLE (This position is not eligible for employment visa sponsorship) Duties & Responsibilities • Maintains, as well as furthers, enhances existing machine learning modules. • Designs and implements new machine learning based approaches based on existing frameworks. • Keeps up to speed with the state of the art of academic research and technology in the industry. • Transfers technologies and solutions to Volkswagen Group. Education and Skills Requirements • Master’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent. PhD preferred. 4-6 years’ professional experience • Strong background in Deep Neural Network Learning, Computer Vision and Machine Learning • Experience with Decentralized AI paradigm • Strong programming skills with Python and TensorFlow • Experience with data gathering, data quality, system architecture, coding best practices. • Experience with Transformers, CNNs, RNN, LSTMs and the latest research trends. • Specification/Documentation of interfaces between software modules. Work Flexibility 5% of time international travel possible. In Belmont, California, the salary range for this role is $118000 – $175000, depending on education and experience.
